abstract.text: Details about a type of ride offered by your ride-booking service.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: When the user books a ride through Siri or Maps, you use

objects to convey information about pricing and passenger capacity for that ride. Prior to booking, Maps asks for ride option objects representing the rides that are available from your service at that moment. Siri and Maps present ride option information to the user in appropriate contexts so that the user has information about potential rides.

objects in response to ride requests and when providing the user with a list of available rides. Always fill in as many properties of ride option objects as makes sense for that ride. Ride options let you specify pricing in several different ways, including as a range of values or as a set of line-item costs. You can also specify information about any special pricing that applies to the ride right now. After configuring the ride option, deliver it with the response object you return back to SiriKit.

abstract.text: Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.

Identifying information about a driver of a ride service.
A specific type of ride-related charge.
Details about a type of ride offered by your ride-booking service.
An array of size options for the user to choose from.
The localized text to display for selecting party size options.
A localized disclaimer message to display to the user before confirming the ride.
The date and time when a ride of this type could be at the userâ€™s location.
An array of price-related items that break down the costs of the ride.
A unique identifier for the ride option.
Initializes and returns a ride option object with the specified name and pickup information.
The name of this ride option.
The range of prices for this ride option.
A user-visible string describing any special pricing considerations that apply to this ride.
A template image for Maps to display when special prices apply.
A user activity object that you can use to launch the app.
A Boolean value indicating whether the price uses a metered fare instead of a fixed price.
A Boolean value indicating whether the price uses a metered fare instead of a fixed price.
The price of a ride involving the specified number of people.
The status of a ride booked through a ride-booking service.
A specific vehicle used by a ride-booking service.
Generate ride options for Maps to display to the user.

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
